wikipedia_page.main: Temple Stanyan (1675–1752) was an English civil servant,  politician and author. He is known for his Grecian History, first published in 1707, which became a standard work on the history of ancient Greece in the early part of the 18th century.

response: Diderot's earliest works included a translation of Temple Stanyan's History of Greece (1743); with two colleagues, François-Vincent Toussaint and Marc-Antoine Eidous, he produced a translation of Robert James's Medicinal Dictionary (1746–1748).Mark Twain, "A Majestic Literary Fossil", originally from Harper's New Monthly Magazine, vol. 80, issue 477, pp. 439–44, February 1890. Online at Harper's site. Accessed 24 September 2006. In 1745, he published a translation of Shaftesbury's Inquiry Concerning Virtue and Merit, to which he had added his own "reflections".

In 1749 he married Mary Tate, however she died the next year without issue and left her home Delapré Abbey to Hardy which he sold in 1756 to Edward Bouverie for £22,000. Following his first wife's death, he married Catharine Stanyan, the daughter of Temple Stanyan. Through Catherine, he inherited Temple Stanyan's estate at Rawlins, Oxfordshire.

He was born on 14 January 1765, and christened "Charles Temple Hardy" on 11 February, at Westminister.England & Wales Christening Records, 1530-1906 He was a son of Admiral Charles Hardy, from whom he inherited a house at Rawlins, in Oxfordshire, and £3,000, on his father's death in 1780."Hardy, Sir Charles, the younger (bap. 1717, d. 1780)", Oxford Dictionary of National Biography, Oxford University Press, 2004 He was possibly named after his maternal grandfather, the historian Temple Stanyan.

link_mentions.page: Clerk of the Privy Council (United Kingdom)

response: Stanyan was the eldest son of Lawrence Stanyan of Monken Hadley, Middlesex and his wife Dorothy Knapp, daughter of Henry Knapp of South Stoke, Oxfordshire. His father was a merchant, farmer and commissioner of the revenue. He was the elder brother of the historian and politician Temple Stanyan.

response: *Temple Hardy (1765–1814), British Royal Navy officer; grandson of Temple Stanyan
*Temple Stanyan (1675–1752), English politician and historian of ancient Greece
